alert.note: Alert for Fayette (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 06 at 11:56PM EDT until May 07 at 3:00PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM EDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of Central Ohio, South Central Ohio and Southwest Ohio, including the following counties, in Central Ohio, Fayette OH. In South Central Ohio, Ross. In Southwest Ohio, Clinton. * WHEN...Until 900 AM EDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1156 PM EDT, local law enforcement reported minor flooding in multiple locations across the advisory area. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Washington Court House, Wilmington, Blanchester, Sabina, New Holland, Staunton, Good Hope, Frankfort, Clarksville, Harveysburg, Martinsville, Clarksburg, Midland, Port William, Milledgeville, Octa, Lees Creek, Reesville, Jasper Mills and Melvin.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
